channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for DE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for DE

item.title: Report E-2025020099
item.description:
Report E-2025020099

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DELIVERY DRIVER WAS DIRECTED BY THE CONSIGNEE EMPLOYEE TO UNLOAD THE TRAILER INTO AN UNLABLED LINE THAT LED TO A TANK CONTAINING PEROXYACETIC ACID. AS THE DRIVER STARTED TO UNLOAD THE CAUSTIC SODA INTO THE PA TANK, A CHEMICAL REACTION OCCURED. THE DRIVER SHUT OFF THE TRAILER VALVE TO STOP THE CAUSTIC SODA UNLOAD. AN UNKOWN AMOUNT OF VAPOR WAS RELEASED, CAUSING THE CONSIGNEE EVACUATION. REPORTED 1 OUNCE RELEASE SO THE REPORT COULD BE FILED NO CT EQUIPMENT FAILURE CONSIGNEE HUMAN ERROR CAUSED THE RELEASE
